refnamediv.refpurpose: Reads the current value of the tempo.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Reads the current value of the tempo.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: kres -- the value of the tempo. If you use a positive value with the -t command-line flag, tempoval returns the percentage increase/decrease from the original tempo of 60 beats per minute. If you don't, its value will be 60 (for 60 beats per minute).

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para:
Here is an example of the tempoval opcode. Remember, it only works if you use the -t flag with Csound. It uses the file tempoval.csd.
Example of the tempoval opcode.
See the sections Real-time Audio and Command Line Flags for more information on using command line flags.
Since 120 beats per minute is a 50% increase over the original 60 beats per minute, its output should include lines like:
kval = 0.500000
